Class Section

  • java.lang.Object
    • Section

  • public class Section
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a section of a course, specified by its number, term offered, start/end times, and its location.
    Author:
    Calvin Cheng

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Section(java.lang.String number, int term, Day[] days, java.lang.String startTime, java.lang.String endTime, Location location)
      Constructs a Section object with given section number and times.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Section

        public Section(java.lang.String number,
               int term,
               Day[] days,
               java.lang.String startTime,
               java.lang.String endTime,
               Location location)
        Constructs a Section object with given section number and times.
        Parameters:
        number - The section number (e.g. "001", "912"). Labs may start with the letter 'L' (e.g. "L2G"), and tutorials may start with the letter 'T' (e.g. "T2C").
        term - The term in which this section is offered (1 or 2).
        days - The days in which this section is offered.
        startTime - The starting time in 24-hour HH:MM format (e.g. "08:30" for 1:30 pm).
        endTime - The ending time in 24-hour HH:MM format (e.g. "13:00" for 1:00 pm).
        location - The location of the section offered.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumber

        public java.lang.String getNumber()
        Returns the number of the section. In most cases, this number is three characters long.

        Labs may start with the letter 'L' (e.g. "L2G"), and tutorials may start with the letter 'T' (e.g. "T2C").

        Returns:
        the number of the section.

      • getTerm

        public byte getTerm()
        Returns the term in which the section is offered. 1 represents a section offered in term 1, and 2 represents a section offered in term 2.
        Returns:
        the term in which the section is offered.

      • getDays

        public Day[] getDays()
        Returns the days during which the section is offered.
        Returns:
        the days during which the section is offered.

      • getStartTime

        public java.lang.String getStartTime()
        Returns the starting time of the section. This time is represented in 24-hour, HH:MM format. For instance, 1:20 pm would be represented as "13:20".
        Returns:
        the starting time of the section.

      • getEndTime

        public java.lang.String getEndTime()
        Returns the ending time of the section. This time is represented in 24-hour, HH:MM format. For instance, 1:20 pm would be represented as "13:20".
        Returns:
        the ending time of the section.

      • getLocation

        public Location getLocation()
        Returns the Location of the section.
        Returns:
        the location of the section.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
